Package it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.waiting

Provides jEQN components to simulate User Waiting Systems.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Names
    Defines names of common usage within jEQN waiting systems simulation components
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    NonPreemptiveWaitingSystem
    Implements a Non-Preemptive Waiting System, ie a waiting system that does not operate service interruption on the cascade Service Center in the case of reception of high priority users
    PreemptiveWaitingSystem
    Defines a Waiting System that support resource preemption upon receiving a users with higher priority
    WaitingSystem
    Defines an abstract user Waiting System simulation component

Package it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.waiting Description

Provides jEQN components to simulate User Waiting Systems.

It is futher subdivided into policies, storages and times.

There are two kind of Waiting Systems made available: PreemptiveWaitingSyste and NonPreemptiveWaitingSystem.

The former simulates a user waiting system that allows incoming user to preempt user under process if certain conditions are met.

The latter simulates a user waiting system that acts passively compared to the preemptive one as it waits for next user request to forward a new user to the in cascade jEQN entity.

Each type must be properly connected to a ServiceCenter which behaviour supports to the dynamic of the specific type.

Each type can be built up by setting its properties

See Also:
it.uniroma2.info.sel.simlab.jeqn.serviceCenters
